Program is to validate entered SCHI records and update overriding data
Invoices can be tested individually by passing an invoice number to
pi.InvoiceLine. If no number (i.e. 0) is passed all invoices belonging
to a schedule are tested.
When testing all invoices, individual messages are suppressed
All encountered Error codes for each invoice will be collected into a
single token string. The first two tokens will be stored in SCHI.
User ineraction will be suppressed when checking multiple records
when prompting a selection the message preceding the call to the
selection table will be used as error instead
Valid entry ranges
Date ranges
Button labels selection screens
Date limits fetched using DATE() this should always be a valid date
Only include invoices which are not deleted and which have been marked
as "in error"
STCY has been validated so no separate check on currency
TermsChecked disables further checks on payment terms
use of debtor or CCRY defaults is always considered valid
Virtuals for temporary storage of debtor terms
===Mandatory Entry
Debtor number, Invoicenumber, Amount

04.01.2006 same rule for ATAXI

Result = 0,1: Debtor OK
case Result = 2: SP0019, 3: SP0002, 4:SP0001

Only useful if debtor and invoice numbers were entered

Still No match found: no further action
matching invoice(s) then allow user to verify
End InvoiceMatch
End Invoice duplication check
Further checks are not usefull if record has been marked as deleted

Invoice amount is to be converted to Heller and Client currencies
04.08.2005 AWK amount
SP0095 AWK Amount must be <= invoice amount
04.01.2006 VAT amount
SP0110 VAT Amount must be <= invoice amount
If any errors detected, update counter
OSP001C1 Suspicious entries. not for lawyer or correction schedules
One check code , so block if - else - else -...
1 Invoice date in the past
2 Invoice date in the future
3 Net days = 0 for debit notes
4 Max allowed payment term exceeded
5 Mark code entered
6 Duplicate invoice
7 WKA Amount > 50% invoice amount
One of the checks applies... update SCHT
End Invoice ok and user has OSP001C modify right (suspicous entries
End SCHI_INVDELETED<>'Y' during check
Using a MF yes after instead of link
Using a MF yes after instead of link
Sql where SCHT_NO or SCHT_LINENO different from checked
Anything else means cancel, mark as error until decided
was if there are any payment terms use these instead of entered terms

SQL_STMT_U.val: select cast (sum (SCHI_INVAMOUNTC) as decimal (13,2)) from :1/SCHI, :1/SCHT where SCHI_DEBC_NO = :2 and SCHI_INVBOOKED = 'N' and SCHI_SCHT_NO = SCHT_NO and SCHT_BOOKED = 'N'

Text.val: 0: Previous entry matches
1: Unique match or selection
2: NonUnique match on zip but no selection
3: Match on debtor only
4: No match
5: No Check/Check aborted/No debternumber entered
For check use Taxnumber if known otherwise use DEBN_ENTERED
Only check if debtornumber was entered
Check for previous entry
Check new entry
In case of a non-unique result select
Czech check: ZIP code enterd as 3 digits numeric then
check only the first 3 digits of the debtor zipcode(s)
3 length check if all numbers
In case of a non-unique result select
If no result with check according to parameter retry with "the other number"
End debtor source = taxnumber / else
End new entry
End debtornumber entered
P=Previous Input, N=New input
End task condition on secondary count >= 2
No point to continue counting when we know there is no unique match,
unless we want to give one zip code piority over the others
DEBC terms
DEBC Mark code
only neccesary if checking for new entry or zipcode doesn't match
D= debtor number only
Z= debtor number and zip
Adress info for no autpmeatic schedules
If an unique match on just debtornumber is found this is ok if either
-Found debtor = "No address details" debtor
-The schedule was delivered as file (SCHT_AUT...)
If a unique match was found use this debtor
18.12.2006 SH SCR12138 Added new test. incl. update of DHIC
Primary count: all records with matching Debtor numbers = counter(0)
Secondary count: all records with a match on any zipcode as well
-Only the secondary count can provide an unique match
-If secondary count yields multiple records selection will be limited
to debtors with matching zipcodes
CZ/SK special check first 3 digits
Normal, check entire filed
Set aside debtor default terms for possible later use
in case of previousmatch or unique match
If the check yields multiple results, this task offers a selection
using the same range.
payment terms
Escape = cancel

If terms are entered in DEBC, these override SCHI entry
10.08.2001 overide no longer applies
--change to v.DEBC...
End task condition on count >= 2
No point to continue counting when we know there is no unique match,
unless we want to give one zip code piority over the others
DEBC terms
If a unique match was found use this debtor
No debtor found result = 4
Multiple debtors found result = 2
Primary count: all records with matching Debtor numbers = counter(0)
Secondary count: all records with a match on any zipcode as well
-Only the secondary count can provide an unique match
-If secondary count yields multiple records selection will be limited
to debtors with matching zipcodes
Set aside debtor default terms for possible later use
in case of previousmatch or unique match
If the check yields multiple results, this task offers a selection
using the same range.
payment terms
